title: Calories in Turkey Lunch Meat
meta_description: Learn calories in turkey lunch meat per 100g, including protein, fat, sodium, carbs, and full nutrition details for easy meal planning.
assumptions: Low-fat deli-sliced turkey breast, smoked or oven-roasted; no added sauces or breading; average brand values.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, fat content, processing, and slice thickness. Check labels for exact values.

quick_answer.text: 100g of turkey lunch meat has about 110 kcal and 20g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaging.

tweaks.label: Honey-glazed or flavored variety per 100 g
Higher-fat dark meat turkey per 100 g

faqs.q: How many calories in one slice of turkey lunch meat?
faqs.a: About 30-35 kcal per 28g slice, depending on thickness.

faqs.q: Is turkey lunch meat high in protein?
faqs.a: Yes, around 20g protein per 100g, making it a lean option.

faqs.q: What's the sodium content in turkey lunch meat?
faqs.a: Typically high at 1300mg per 100g; opt for low-sodium if watching intake.

faqs.q: Does turkey lunch meat have carbs?
faqs.a: Low, about 2g per 100g, mostly from any added flavors or preservatives.

faqs.q: How does preparation affect calories in turkey lunch meat?
faqs.a: Deli-sliced is lowest; frying or adding mayo increases calories significantly.
